meanings.definition: To block or fill (a passage) with obstacles or an obstacle.
meanings.sent1: The fallen tree was obstructing the path through the forest.
meanings.sent2: The parked car was obstructing traffic on the narrow street.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel was obstructing the bird feeder, causing a commotion.
meanings.sent4: Her fear of failure was obstructing her path to success like a giant boulder.
meanings.sent5: The thick fog was obstructing visibility, making it hard to see anything ahead.

meanings.definition: To impede, retard, or interfere with; hinder.
meanings.sent1: The construction noise was obstructing my ability to concentrate on my work.
meanings.sent2: The heavy rain was obstructing the progress of the outdoor event.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy was obstructing the cat's attempts to nap peacefully.
meanings.sent4: His stubbornness was obstructing the negotiation process, causing delays.
meanings.sent5: The loud music was obstructing communication, making it difficult to hear each other.
